attributes.action: Open age restrictions for Lifetime ISA
attributes.background:
Allow to open and contribute until 50 years old
Currently only available to 18 to 40 years of age
Pays 25% bonus pa on Â£4k

attributes.action: Set out principles for any negotiation pertaining to leaving the European Union
attributes.background: Parliament should vote on a motion supporting access to European markets, free movement of people, and compatibility with major areas of European law. This being a move to boost confidence for business and markets, and to reassure the European citizens living and working in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently great uncertainty and anxiety both for business and financial markets, and for the many Europeans who live and work as part of our communities; friends, colleagues and loved ones. Parliament should act to create certainty and confidence, setting out the principles on which any negotiation should be based. This should include the key areas such as free movement, access to markets, and legal compatibility such topics as data protection.

attributes.action: Referendum results less than 60-40 and 75% turnout should go to a second round.
attributes.background: The two most recent referendums (referenda) in the UK did not 'convincingly' reflect the opinion of the general public and did not prove their wishes beyond 'reasonable doubt'.

attributes.action: Electoral vote of acceptance of any Prime minister not Elected
attributes.background: A lot of people vote for the public face of a political party are electing a Prime minister to lead the country, if a political party in Government has to choose a new leader whom will become Prime minister the electorate should have the right approve or reject that person.

attributes.action: Amend the Human Rights Act to support informed public debate.
attributes.background: Only when we have a clear view of issues can we make informed choice, people cannot make functional choices when they do not know what they are choosing. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.
attributes.additional_details: I propose an additional article under the UK Human Rights Act which prevents the dumbing down and obfuscation of public debate. It is the duty of public servants to bring clarity and accuracy to public debate to establish objectives and clean information both pro and con. It should be an offence for those in public office to provide misleading, inaccurate or untruthful information that obfuscates public debate.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on rejoining the EU every tenth year, starting June 2026.
attributes.background:
Young people voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU (about 75% of those aged 18-24).

To give them hope, we're asking that in June 2026, and in every tenth June afterwards so long as Britain is outside the EU, a referendum be held on the question "Should Britain now apply to rejoin the EU?".

attributes.action: Have better support for people with learning disabilities in schools
attributes.background: Aa someone who has learning disabilities I feel like I havent had enough support.

attributes.action: Open The United Kingdom's borders for free trade with everyone in the world.
attributes.background: Further to the EU Referendum which voted for The United Kingdom to leave the European Union, I propose that we open our borders for the free movement of goods to and from anywhere in the world.

attributes.action: New EU referendum should Scotland leave the UK and break the Union.
attributes.background: This petition calls for a suspension of any action for an exit from the EU until the issue of Scottish independance is resolved. If Scotland leave and the UK breaks up then a new question would need to be posed, reflecting the nature of the change, the original question becoming invalid.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition aims for Parliament to consider and plan through any serious changes that may result from Scottish independance and the impact this would have on the recent referendum result and mindset of the voting public.

The original referendum question posed was for the United Kingdom exiting the EU, should Scotland gain independance then the UK breaks up and the question is void, given the change of circumstances.

attributes.action: Set up a public inquiry to examine the regulation of political campaigns.
attributes.background:
â...political campaign material in the UK is not regulated...it is a matter for voters to decide...whether they consider it accurate or not.â - Electoral Commission

We, the undersigned, ask for a wide-ranging public inquiry, similar to the Leveson inquiry, to be set up to consider the following:
attributes.additional_details:
1) Is there sufficient independent regulation in place to ensure that political campaigns and individuals act in line with the Nolan principles*? 
2) Should a regulator be given the authority to regulate political advertising?
3) Should the media be required to include political balance in news articles? 

*https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-7-principles-of-public-life/the-7-principles-of-public-life--2

attributes.action: Put more funding towards schools and other public services.
attributes.background: Public services such as schools and the NHS are not very well funded. After leaving the EU, we will be apparently saving Â£350 million a week. Some of this money should go to public services.

attributes.action: Allow the City and Greater London to join the EU
attributes.background: Given the EU referendum result showed a large discrepancy of opinion between those voting in London and those voting in England and Wales, we would like to initiate proceedings for the City and Greater London to join the EU.

attributes.action: A new referendum: Leave the EU now or in 2036 (subject to a further referendum)?
attributes.background: We have voted to leave the EU which is irreversible. We now need a referendum to ascertain whether we leave the EU now or in 20 years' time (subject to a further referendum, of course)?
attributes.additional_details: The EU is not perfect and will probably be subject to some kind of reform in the coming decades. This additional referendum is to find out if the UK population would like postpone our exit pending any changes that may occur within the union.

attributes.action: Work with the Commonwealth of Nations to establish an economic union
attributes.background: We call upon Her Majesty, the government and the British Parliament to actively seek cooperation with other commonwealth countries to establish a strong union/community that promotes greater social, political & economic harmony amongst those countries we have a strong historical relationships with.
attributes.additional_details: The people of the UK have voted to leave the EU, which will cause a huge economic impact. This vote is influenced by strong concerns regarding the legitimacy of a democratic mandate within the European Commission. There are also many constitutional questions this raises in terms of future arrangements between nations within the UK such as Scottish autonomy & Northern Ireland's relationship with Ireland. Commonwealth countries have already endorsed seeking free trade between commonwealth members.

attributes.action: Form an emergency government made of leaders of each major political party
attributes.background:
This emergency government will be responsible for negotiating the exit from the EU.
Nominated leaders from each major political party will join together to negotiate so that every member of the public will be represented, and not just those who voted for a particular individual party.

attributes.action: Make Bristol an independent city state to rejoin the European Union.
attributes.background: The majority of Bristol voted to remain in the EU.  Lets make our vote count!

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Greater London becoming an independent, EU member state
attributes.background: We want a referendum held in Greater London on becoming an independent, federal state, that will remain a member of the European Union. This reflects the wishes of the majority of Londoners to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details: The referendum on the 23rd of June clearly showed a divide in the beliefs of Londoners and the majority of the rest of England. Continued membership of the EU is vital if London is to remain the biggest financial centre in Europe. In addition, leaving would clearly go against the wishes of the majority of Londoners. We also believe that a divorce from the UK would be less traumatic than a split from the 450 million strong EU population

attributes.action: Overhaul The New GCSE's Making Them Easier For Students Sitting Them In 2017
attributes.background: The New GCSE's Have been declared 'too hard' by the exams regulator. Students will be sitting them around June 2017 and so far Mocks and Practice papers have shown the pass rate to be low! Others have quoted that a mark lower than 50% would be required to achieve an A Grade! They are just too hard.
attributes.additional_details:
We Want The Goverment To Consider changing the Maths exams for 2017 making them less challenging for students, many experts have agreed they are simply to hard! 
Please read  the following BBC Article http://goo.gl/FCxYI7 The changes brought in my Michael Gove were exceptionally radical and don't allow children to achieve their fullest potential, Sign the petition to make the new GCSEs fairer for our kids and the leaders of the future.

attributes.action: Make June 22nd a national holiday, in tribute to Jo Cox. Cox's Day
attributes.background: Request an annual holiday as a reminder of Jo Cox and inspirational work and influence on peace and human rights. Hate will never win #moreincommon

attributes.action: Change the law on Historic Sexual abuse and assault cases and penalties
attributes.background: If a historic sexual abuse/assault case is brought before a court, if the case occurred earlier than 2003 a person prosecuted of the crime has a penalty or prison sentence which refers to the law under that point in time. All historic cases should use the current sentencing for historic cases also
attributes.additional_details: The current cases means that someone who abused someone in 1970's or 1980's only allows a person to be prosecuted under the laws of that time undermining the sentencing of someone who may have committed abhorent crimes against people, this would allow a better and more efficient way to proscute historical sexual crimes.

attributes.action: Protect identities of those subject to unsubstantiated allegations of sex abuse
attributes.background:
Several big name celebrities have been accused of historic sex abuse  their identities released to the public domain before any of the unsubstantiated allegations have been investigated.
I want to see a change in the law that protects the identity of these persons until charged with any offences.

attributes.action: Force credit/debit card providers allow a customer block on contactless payments
attributes.background: Contactless payments are a security risk. They permit criminals to collect users data using unauthorised scanners, the "Contactless Infusion X5" being sold by "CC Buddies" for Â£500, is just one of them.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following recent Daily Star article:-

http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/522417/Fraud-clone-bank-cards-contactless-device

attributes.action: Deploy warships in the English Channel to stop and deter illegal migrants.
attributes.background: Over the past few weeks there have been known several incidents of illegal migrants trying to cross the English Channel to get in the UK. So far only one of the attempted crossings have been successful but it is inevitable that more will get into the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
For too long, the UK has been lenient when it comes to illegals trying to get into our nation and we must set an example to defend ourselves from possible terrorists posing as migrants (as seen during the Cologne and Paris attacks). And also to prevent further actual refugees from risking their lives trying to get into the UK.

I ask the Government to deploy warships into the English Channel to; stop and turn around illegals, deter further illegals from risking their lives in the effort to get into the UK, and if necessary use lethal force to defend British waters.

attributes.action: A review of the British High Comission Visa Department in Pakistan.
attributes.background: The British High Comission has been rejecting thousands of UK Visa applicants from Pakistan in a unsophisticated way. So I plead to the British Government to review the ongoing in Pakistan's visa department, as rate of rejection is currently higher than ever, and this is not humanly right.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the British High Commission charges fees from Rs14,000 to Rs100,000 for visas of different categories and durations. In some cases Pakistanis have submitted a number of a applications to the BHC for visas, and paid the fee a number of times, only to be turned down without a justifiable reason. This could be in fear of terrorism, which is understandable at the current time, however this does not highlight why thousands of applicants are being tuned down without a justified reason.

attributes.action: Oppose changes to make you pay full market rent on your council home.
attributes.background: A Government Housing and Planning Bill will see people even on modest incomes threatened with the prospect of paying full market rent in their council and housing association homes (http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN06804/SN06804.pdf).
attributes.additional_details: Ending secure council tenancies means the government is legislating to deny families a stable home.

attributes.action: require crowdfunding web to list all companys that failed after taking funding
attributes.background:
i do invest regular on crowdfunding websites but i find that the platforms hide this info to get more investors invest money in start ups 
they just advertise the succes storry and hide the failed companys i recently asked a list of all failed companys from a crowdfunding platforms but was refused

attributes.action: Turn off traffic lights for ALL roundabouts outside of peak times.
attributes.background: I drive for a living (as a service engineer) and cover about 25k annually. I am also qualified HGV1 and Motorcyle licence holder. I was a Combat driver in the TA and have also driven articulated commercial vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: The menace of traffic lights on roundabouts is a constant theme of irritation and disbelief amongst the drivers I have spoken with. Many actually ignore them late at night and risk a prosecution rather than adhere to the Highway Code. Additionally, I live near a large motorway access road junction (M27 J8.) The roundabout at the top of the slip road always flows better when the lights breakdown. I have seen this on a few occasions. I drive this roundabout continually to and from work.

attributes.action: Increase the speed limit on roads for vans or put up speed road sign for vans.
attributes.background: When driving a transit type van the national speed limit  is lower for vans than cars. Speed signs are displayed for cars but not vans. Most van drivers also drive a car so it can be confusing when there are no speed respeater signs for vans. Van technology has improved making them safer.

attributes.action: Reduce planning restrictions when converting derelict land into amenity space
attributes.background: I am 77 year old passionate gardener trying to rescue derelict land.  It had lots of non-native invasive weeds. I have transformed the space into a haven for wildlife. Salford council have taken over a year to grant permission, costing me 6k on surveys and fees. This should be quicker and cheaper.
attributes.additional_details:
Japanese Knotweed and Himalayan Balsam, invasive weeds:
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/prevent-the-spread-of-harmful-invasive-and-non-native-plants

Before and after pictures of the derelict land in question:
https://thesecretvalley.com/2014/05/27/swan/
(I am cutting down Himalayan Balsam with a scythe)

Himalayan Balsam
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/05/09/himalayan-bolsom/

Japanese knotweed
https://thesecretvalley.com/2012/08/09/clearing-and-burning-the-japanese-knotweed/

attributes.action: Scrap the DBS system because most immigrants have no past record.
attributes.background: As a graduate in International Politics/Security I think its wrong for the British people to be penalised when looking for a job just because they have a conviction. When compared to the thousands of immigrants that arrive unlawfully in Britain with no prior record of their past.
attributes.additional_details: Please note, the barred list is a separate issue and is most definitely useful for protecting the vulnerable but just because someone has committed for example financial crime this does not mean that they would hurt someone. I believe this country will lose many of its citizens slowly but surely because one by one people will leave this and travel to where they feel more secure.

attributes.action: Boycott American trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected US president
attributes.background: This petition supports the boycott of US trade in the event of Donald Trump being elected president.  Trump endorses a manifesto built on intolerance and a lack of respect for the natural resources we should be protecting.  The implications of his election would impact far beyond the US borders.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cbsnews.com/media/is-donald-trump-a-menace-to-the-global-economy/

http://edition.cnn.com/2015/12/07/politics/donald-trump-muslim-ban-immigration/

http://www.nationalreview.com/article/434660/donald-trump-foreign-policy-incoherent-shallow

attributes.action: Orgnanise a blockade of the Libyan coast to stop people trafficking.
attributes.background: Around 150,000 migrants travelled from Libya to Italy by boat last year and, so far this year, more than 37,000 people have been intercepted in the Mediterranean and taken to Italian ports. Hundreds are believed to have died after their overloaded vessels sank or capsized.
attributes.additional_details: Lord West, ex-First Sealord and Chief of Naval Staff, said such a measure would require 10 Navy frigates and destroyers, along with helicopters, drones and other intelligence and surveillance capability

attributes.action: Products with lithium batteries to have a child-safe fastening and quantum coat
attributes.background: Rising incidence of 'button batteries' containing lithium manganese cause serious/fatal injuries in children. There are 3,000 ingestions of these batteries p.a. and 48 deaths. The NHS recently issued a public announcement re dangers, following 5 serious injuries and 1 fatality in NW England alone.
attributes.additional_details:
1) The incidence of button battery injuries in the North West of England:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-manchester-29610570

2) http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/article-2969115/How-small-batteries-new-child-killer-look-innocuous-cause-utterly-horrific-internal-burns.html

3) Statistical analysis:
www.poison.org/battery/fatalcases

4) http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/two-year-old-girl-dies-after-swallowing-button-battery-over-christmas-in-us-a6793846.html

attributes.action: Make childhood vaccinations a legal requirement for state-school education
attributes.background: Un-vaccinated children pose a potentially serious risk to the health of other children - particularly those for whom vaccines are less effective or who are medically unable to be vaccinated. Where the failure to vaccinate has no medical basis, other children should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent years have seen a rise in outbreaks of preventable diseases, which has been at least partially attributed to an increase in parents electing not to have their children vaccinated. These include smallpox (which had been all but eradicated by vaccination), and measles. 
Children are at particular risk, due to the way they play very closely together, and their less developed immune systems.
In Australia, it is already a requirement for receipt of state welfare.

attributes.action: Pedestrian crossings by all schools
attributes.background: 2incidents have happened at my daughters school recently, I have wrote to local council to ask about a pedestrian crossing and their response was until there is a fatality, the answer is no! This IS DISGRACEFUL. I petition for crossings for all parents to get their children to school safely.

attributes.action: To scrap the literacy and numeracy tests for those wanting to become teachers.
attributes.background: These tests are preventing future teachers from beginning their training. There are many requirements that need to be met and the schools and universities that provide the training are losing students because of the governments involvement. The training providers don't even approve of these tests.
attributes.additional_details: Last year I was accepted by a school and university. I had completed my degree, achieved the necessary GCSE results, gained 2 years experience of working in education. However, after 3 attempts I failed the numeracy and I am now frozen out for 2 years. After contacting Nicky Morgan's office, I received a reply stating that I am not ready to be a teacher. The questions that are asked are irrelevant to teaching especially when the tests are not relevant to the subjects that trainees want to teach.

attributes.action: An alternative intergrated solution to Heathrow airport expansion
attributes.background:
Heathrow expansion can only exasperate West Londonâs housing and congestion problems.
I believe Londonâs future success and those of rest of UK will best be served by deliberately planning to reduce pressures on London's limited resources. 
Hence this proposal as a two prong solution.
attributes.additional_details:
1)Build a *new* international airport(linked to HS2), of similar size to Heathrow, around Birmingham. 
2)Divert half of all Heathrow's contracts to the new airport. Reducing pressures on London's resources. 
Some of the benefits are
â¢Sharing traffic between West/North of London. 
â¢More passenger capacity than a single runway extension.
â¢Help tourism/service industry in the north of UK. 
â¢In Emergencies, as both airports are of similar size, they can better cope with diversion of air traffic.

attributes.action: Allow all students access to clean water during school time.
attributes.background: In many school across the country students have been denied access to clean water during school. Even though everyone in our country has clean, fresh running water that is accessible to everyone many school do not allow students to get water during lessons and school. We cannot allow this to happen

attributes.action: Vote that the house has no confidence in the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: He's not fit to hold the office of Prime Minister because he has knowingly put the UK in a position which he believed will undermine the security of the UK, destabilise Europe and the world economy, diminish the capabilities of our intelligence services and will cause mass unemployment.
attributes.additional_details: He has without necessity called for a referendum which could result in the UKs exit from the EU believing it will be ruinous to the nation.  In numerous speeches made by himself and his ministers have made it abundantly clear that he considers a possible exit from the EU would be disastrous for the economic welfare and security of the nation. He's therefore been derelict in his duty to defend the nation against threat by setting in motion a chain of events he believes will harm the UK.

attributes.action: Move parliament to "Skegness". UK Parliament tour seaside resorts during refurb.
attributes.background: Due to 6 years of repairs to the Palace of Westminster,  parliament will be held in a different location. This petition asks the government to discuss touring seaside towns during the repairs. This would utilise our vast holiday park infrustucture, facilitate regenerration and showcase democracy.

attributes.action: Change the law to stop insurance companies discrimating against people with HIV
attributes.background: Currently people living with HIV, who are healthy and who's health is not at risk can pay astronomically more than those who are not living with the condition when taking out travel insurance. This is compunded by people with the condition being completely discounted from certain insurance cover.

attributes.action: Disband the polices current internal complaints investigation Service & the IPCC
attributes.background:
Two years ago the government voted to allow police to investigate All matters internally.

Instead of putting all cases, of police assualts against civilians or common law breaches, straight to the CPS, 

They now get a chance to cover up the matter or potentially 'falsify' the evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The current police complaints system, is currently full of potential:

1. Corruption.

2. Conflict of interest - of the investigators knowing the person or persons that they are investigating.

3. Power or knowledge to potentially contaminate the incidence.

4. Potential or knowledge of how to falsify the evidence and manipulate the witness's:

    A. By only asking the right question or by
    misleading the witness into saying the right 
    answer, to allow the true police criminal to walk.

attributes.action: Offer a free workshop on healthy eating on a budget to all UK residents
attributes.background: Myth; 'eating healthily is more expensive than buying junk food'. Pre-packed food or pre-prepared food can be much more expensive and full of sugars, fats and preservatives than making from scratch. More education is needed to make healthy shopping choices, ultimately improving the nation's health.
attributes.additional_details:
If people are educated on how to read the supermarket price labels of fruit and veg for instance, quite often it is cheaper to buy loose vegetables than it is to buy pre-packed. Educate on how simple healthy meals can be made with very few cheap ingredients. e.g.

Vegetarian tomato pasta dish; home-made total price for a family of 4; Â£0.89.

If wanting to add meat (Beef mince as an addition) ; Total price Â£2.89 for 4 servings.

Alternative pre-packed pre-made product, 4 servings; Â£6.60.

attributes.action: Call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to engage with constituents
attributes.background: Every four years, EU citizens vote on democratic representatives in the European Parliament (MEPs). Very few people know who their MEP is. If the UK votes to stay in the European Union, the Government must call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to be more accessible and open to constituents.
attributes.additional_details: Various surveys showing how much people in the UK know about their MEP http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2014/may/10/voters-cant-name-their-mep http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/hands-up-if-you-know-who-your-mep-is-8679242.html

attributes.action: We want a referendum to be held on English membership of the United kingdom.
attributes.background: England would be stronger outside the United Kingdom for the simple reason that Scotland, Wales and Northern island  contribute far less to the Union than they take out. As a result of this England would be stronger outside the UK.

attributes.action: Give British Transport Police Officer's equal powers as Home Office colleagues
attributes.background: BTP officers have limited Jurisdiction dealing with matters non rail related. BTP officers are trained to the same standards as Home Office Colleagues and often assist in mutual aid scenarios. In order to protect the public, and BTP Officers, this petition proposes parity with Home Office powers.
attributes.additional_details:
The public, when they see a police officer make no distinction between police force. Officers seek to protect the public and this is what the public expects. Having a visible police force with 'second rate' powers risks damaging public confidence in policing as they may not be able to intervene effectively.

This amendment would give security to BTP officers who are acting in the public interest to prevent and detect crime as well as ensuring good order in society.

attributes.action: Equalise public spending per capita throughout the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland get higher payments per capita than England. This is unreasonable. All countries in the UK should receive the same amount per capita.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014/15, public spending per capita in the UK as a whole was Â£8,913. In England, it was Â£8,638 (3% below the UK average). This compares with:
â¢ Scotland: Â£10,374 (16% above the UK average â 20% higher than England)
â¢ Wales: Â£9,904 (11% above the UK average â 14.7% higher than England)
â¢ Northern Ireland Â£11,106 (25% above the UK average â 28.6% higher than England).
(Data source: House of Commons Briefing Paper Number 04300, 8 March 2015)

attributes.action: Make drifting in an empty open space legal
attributes.background: People all over the country put people in danger by drifting on roads and getting "section 59's" for drifting around in an empty car park, we need to get people off the road and let the people enjoy some fun off-road and out of harms way of the public.
attributes.additional_details: I have known people to drift in an empty open car park safely and receive cautions and/or had their cars seized.  If this is done safely and away from members of the public then why penalise them?

attributes.action: To revoke the need to provide a certificate of destruction for these vehicles.
attributes.background: The petition can be divided into 3 categories: 1.Heritage -Save many rare classic vehicles from destruction. 2.Economic -makes no sense financially.Costs more to destroy a valuable commodity resulting in lower value scrap. 3.Impact on the environment -no evidence the scheme helps the environment.
attributes.additional_details: Huge Public interest and media following to save these vehicles and in doing so protect our motoring heritage and boost trade within the classic car sector.

attributes.action: Drivers to take a refresher driving test when renewing their driving licence.
attributes.background: The standard of driving in the United Kingdom has deteriorated dramatically in recent years, and the problem is that once a driver has passed their test, they can drive on a UK licence until they reach 70 years of age. In order to reduce accidents, we need a new, more proactive approach.
